subject: Re: [LH] Conclusion
body:
"Donny Bravo"  wrote in message 
news:donnybravo-6C5D73.00321316052007@[66.250.146.154]...
> In article <9d4443a2087dbc61d7cc054eea22ab7b@vispa.com>,
> boolbar@gaffa.vispa.com (Boolbar) wrote:
>
>> I agree there isn't enough good material to justify a double CD and some 
>> of
>> it is bland.
>> I think that some of the material is among the best that Kate has ever 
>> done
>> and some of it among the worst. We have 4 great tracks, 4 reasonable
>> tracks, 3 decent linking pieces, 4 varying but ultimately bland tracks 
>> and
>> one of the least decent Kate singles ever. Overall her 4th best album, 
>> just
>> about nudging The Sensual World into 5th place.
>> (If KOTM, HTBI, SIB were removed for B-sides and Pi & Nocturn given a 
>> good
>> kicking then this would have been so much better.)
>
> Well, now, let's get this discussion rolling along.
>
> What are your 4 great tracks? Your 4 reasonable tracks? Your 4 bland
> tracks?
>
> I can't agree about KOTM. I find it to be one of the more redeemable
> songs on the set. If it were given a SIYL treatment, it would have been
> that much better.
>
> And, looking back, TSW might just be my favorite KB album, taken as a
> whole. HOL is half-great, but, oh, what a half. I also love TD and NFE.
> So those are the big 4 long-players for me.



hmmm, well, I think HoL is more than "half greaat," and I have played it a 
lot maore than I have played TSW, but, I still feel that TSW is Kate's best 
work. NFE may still be the one I've played the most.




>
> TKI is something special, but not overwhelmingly strong from start to
> finish. Lionheart and Ae are flawed. TRS suffers from contributions by
> awful mainstream artists who are clearly not worth of Kate Bush.
>
> - Donny
>
